sponsor.partnerMessage: Navigating today's real estate market can be difficult. Whether you are buying or selling, you will want Barbara Stefanis on your side. Contact her today to get your real estate journey started on the right foot.

posts.title: Compost Champs
posts.content:
Fayetteville’s food waste drop-off program won the Arkansas Recycling Coalition’s 2021 Recycling Education Program of the Year award.

  • Reduce, reuse, recycle: The program is set up for Fayetteville residents to collect their food waste at home to then drop off at one of five drop-off locations in the city. For residents to participate in the program, the Recycling and Trash Division of Fayetteville provides free buckets and lids for food waste. 
  • Well deserved: Fayetteville’s Compost Facility turns waste into nutrient rich compost, meriting the award with the stipulations that a city makes “a significant contribution to the advancement of waste reduction, recycling and sustainability in Arkansas.” 

Read the full press release HERE.

posts.title: Barking Brewery
posts.content:
Alright you dog people, have you ever wished you could take your pup into the bar?? Well, wish no longer. 

  • Something for everyone: The Ozark Beer Company is currently preparing a new location inside of Rope Hounds in Bentonville. The new dog-friendly taproom will feature small batch, and eventually pilot batches of tap-room only draught year round. 
  • Hand crafted: Rope Hounds is a local pet supply store right off the square in Bentonville that makes things like dog leases and collars by hand, in-store. Ozark Beer at Rope Hounds is set to open later this fall to you and your furry friends.

For updates, follow their IG HERE.

posts.title: "Think and Do Tank"
posts.content:
Heartland Forward is raising $4m to expand their accelerator program for entrepreneurs in the "heartland" of the US. 

  • Outcome focused: Heartland Forward is a nonprofit “think and do tank” based in Bentonville. Its mission is to provide resources to entrepreneurs and surround them with mentors so as to improve economic performance in the central US. 
  • Let it be you: The goal is to reach 1,000 entrepreneurs by 2023. All selected applicants will receive a "$5,000 Pebble Grant, training and assistance to run a rapid, small-scale test of their ideas."

Read the full Talk Business & Politics story HERE.

posts.title: Life of a Dam
posts.content:
Tuesday night, Bentonville City Council agreed to begin the process of removing the failed Lake Bella Vista Dam.

  • History: The Lake Bella Vista Dam has been a hot topic for the surrounding communities for years, and this past April it was breached due to heavy rain. In its last City Council meeting, the Bentonville City Council decided to remove it.
  • Next steps: The Council is going to hire a design team to develop a plan for the site’s next purpose. It is still to be determined if there will be another dam to replace the old one, or if the Little Sugar Creek will be reestablished as a free flowing stream, as is the Council’s desire. 

Read the Council’s resolution in the meeting agenda HERE.

posts.title: Let's Go, Dancing Queens
posts.content:
Today is the last Thursday of September, meaning it is the last Live at Turnbow event of the season. 

  • Hip-swingin’ good: DJ Susie Q and Little Yei are the closing acts, bringing “backyard baile to Downtown Springdale.” On the setlist is Latin dancing classics, Spanish reggae, and hip-hop in celebration of Hispanic Heritage Month. 
  • One last time: Music starts at 6:30 and the outdoor dining district will have all your favorite food and drinks to set the best vibe for your experience in Downtown Springdale.

For more event details, click HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Pizzaroke Night: For $40 you and your family can have 2 hrs of karaoke, 1 whole pizza and drinks at Big Box Karaoke.*
  • Free show: Grace Potter. The Momentary. Tonight.
  • Fame: The NYT featured Theatre Squared's world premiere of Designing Women.
  • Active outdoors: Arkansas Outside.com has an outdoor events calendar to help plan your fall.
  • Local nominee: Help vote Eureka Springs as the Best Small Town Cultural Scene!
  • What can we say? We can't help that we live in a beautiful place. Stats say tourism is on its way.
  • Shout out: We'd love to feature you in our newsletter! Check out our advertising deals HERE.

Correction: On Tuesday we said the community was invited to take photos with the Naturals baseball team and their championship trophy. Sadly that is not the case. You are, however, invited to take photos with the championship trophy but no players will be there.
